Class Verify

java.lang.Object
Verify
class Verify extends Object
Class Verify holds basic methods for verifying that the end user gives proper input to be held by the Person object in the given field of the contactsbook.
Author:
Juho Yli-Rajala

  • Constructor Details

    • Verify

      Verify()

  • Method Details

    • verifyId

      public static boolean verifyId(String inputid)
      The method verifyId() verifies if the given input was in the correct Finlands personal id format. The validation process is set so that the String can not be empty.
      Parameters:
      inputid - End users input inputid is the String that the method then proceeds to verify.
      centurysign - Is used to define all the possible inputs a centurysign holds in the Finnish id format.
      controlcha - Is used to define all the possible inputs the controlcharacter holds in the Finnish id format.
      Returns:
      return a boolean value true if the given input was in the correct Finlands personal id format and false if it wasn't.

    • verifyFname

      public static boolean verifyFname(String inputfname)
      The method verifyFname() verifies if the given input was a valid firstname. The method requires the given String input to be atleast 2 characters long and no longer than 39 characters. If the name contains '-' it can not be the first or the last char of the String. The validation process is set so that the String can not be empty.
      Parameters:
      inputfname - End users input inputfname is the String that the method then proceeds to verify.
      Returns:
      return a boolean value true if the given input was a valid firstname and false if it wasn't.

    • verifyLname

      public static boolean verifyLname(String inputlname)
      The method verifyLname() verifies if the given input was a valid lastname. The method requires the given String input to be atleast 2 characters long and no longer than 39 characters. If the name contains '-' it can not be the first or the last char of the String. The validation process is set so that the String can not be empty.
      Parameters:
      inputLname - End users input inputlname is the String that the method then proceeds to verify.
      Returns:
      return a boolean value true if the given input was a valid lastname and false if it wasn't.

    • verifyPhoneNo

      public static boolean verifyPhoneNo(String inputphone)
      The method verifyPhoneNo() verifies if the given input was a valid phonenumber. The method requires the given String input to be atleast 3 numbers long and no greater than 11. If the number given includes a '+' sign it can be atleast 4 chars long and no greater than 12. The validation process is set so that the String can not be empty.
      Parameters:
      inputphone - End users input inputphone is the String that the method then proceeds to verify.
      pluscount - This counts down how many '+' chars the String contains.
      plusfirst - This checks if the first char of the String was '+'.
      stringvalid - This validates if the given String contained only certain chars using regex.
      Returns:
      return a boolean value true if the given input was a valid phonenumber and false if it wasn't.

    • verifyAddress

      public static boolean verifyAddress(String inputaddress)
      The method verifyAddress() verifies if the given input was a valid address. The validation process is set so that the String can also be " " since the field is not mandatory.
      Parameters:
      inputaddress - End users input inputaddress is the String that the method then proceeds to verify.
      Returns:
      return a boolean value true if the given input was a valid inputaddress and false if it wasn't.

    • verifyEmail

      public static boolean verifyEmail(String inputemail)
      The method verifyEmail() verifies if the given input was a valid email address. The method requires the given String input to have atleast one character as ',' and also one character as '@', but these characters cannot be set as the first or last character of String or back to back. The validation process is set so that the String can also be " " since the field is not mandatory.
      Parameters:
      inputemail - End users input inputaddress is the String that the method then proceeds to verify.
      verify - This is a boolean value that validates if all the requirements for a valid String are met.
      atcount - This holds the number of how many '@' chars the String has.
      dotcount - This holds the number of how many '.' chars the String has.
      atsignindex - This holds the index where the '@' char is in the String and it is used when defining that the character next to '@' is not '.'.
      Returns:
      return a boolean value true if the given input was a valid inputemail and false if it wasn't.

    • verifyYesNo

      public static boolean verifyYesNo(String input)
      The method verifyYesNo() simply verifies if the given input was a character '1' or '2'.
      Parameters:
      input - Is the end users input that the method then proceeds to verify.
      Returns:
      return a boolean value true if the given input was a character '1' or '2'. and false if it wasn't.
